revised_title: Sidney Howard Vines: A Pioneering Botanist and Educator
tldr: Sidney Howard Vines was a renowned botanist and educator who made significant contributions to the field of botany, particularly in plant physiology and proteolytic enzymes. He established a flourishing school of botany at Cambridge and later served as the Sherardian Professor at Oxford. Vines was also a dedicated teacher, known for his clear and engaging lectures that inspired many students to pursue careers in botany.
